name: Thornbury Castle and Tudor Gardens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have debated writing this review for a number of reasons. The hotel itself is beautiful. The grounds, the rooms, the castle itself, very nice. What we found extremely disappointing, no appalling, was the welcome.
reviews.title: Unpleasant welcome!

likes.liked: — The gardens, but you can see similar at any English park.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Upon our entry into the lobby we were asked quite blatantly, "Are you making a delivery?" Both my husband and I were casually dressed as we were touring around the countryside. I was completely disgusted.
reviews.title: An experience, as well as a place to stay

likes.liked: — The atmosphere, the dinner experience, the castle and its grounds

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When my husband said "No, we're checking in." There was no apology or remark from whom I am sure was the manager. This seemed to set the mood for the evening. We quickly changed and went else where for dinner. When we returned I asked if a tray of tea and coffee could be sent up to our room. We waited almost an hour. When I called down I was told the kitchen just closed. In a place like this I was shocked that the kitchen closes. Again, no apology for their rudeness. The next morning we went down for breakfast. It was edible but not appetizing.
reviews.title: Amazing Rooms

likes.disliked: — The price - but for a special occasion who cares how much it costs?!?!?!?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: So, if you are the type of person that expects to get what you pay for and expects to be treated with courtesy, I would not stay at this place even if the rooms were free.
reviews.title: Enchanting Castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wanted to give my Japanese inlaws a proper English castle experience - and Thornbury more than delivered. Replete with battlements, secret doors and romantic ruins, Thornbuy is everyone's fantasy of how a castle should look. It also turns out to be a very decent hotel.
reviews.title: A special stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just had the most wonderful weekend stopping Saturday night at Thornbury Castle as a special Birthday treat. The location is fabulous with lovely grounds to explore and next to a beautiful Church. The welcome was very friendly and efficient and made it special right from the start. We stopped in the Duke's Bedchamber where Henry VIII and Anne Boleyn stayed which is a fantastic room, spacious, spotlessly clean, well equipped, good selection of toiletries, bottled water and a decanter of sherry. Tea/coffee facilities in the room would have been nice but these can be ordered when you arrive. What an experience to think that you are stopping in the very room that they stayed in. Had dinner and the only fault there was that it did take them a very long time to take our order. Having said that this was the only hitch in an otherwise perfect weekend. The food was superb, the dining area intimate and the standard of service faultless. When we returned to our bedroom the bed had been turned down, a chocolate left on each bedside table and the empty water bottles replaced. The fire was also very welcome in the room and lovely to sit in front of and relax before bed. Breakfast was excellent, good choice and served quickly. Every member of staff was extremely helpful, friendly and efficient. It is very expensive but well worth it for a special occasion
reviews.title: Very Special

likes.liked: — The experience of stopping in the same room as Henry VIII

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is amazing. Expensive- especially if you eat on site, but excellent food, service and obviously, atmosphere. I believe Anne Bolelyn and Henry stayed here after they'd been married about a year- a fact I found fascinating and which added a magical note to our visit. We also found the town quite charming as well as within reasonable driving distance from Stonehenge and Glastonbury Abbey and Tor. It is small for what I thought a castle would be, but honestly this hotel has been one our best travel experiences- give it a try even if only for a splurge night!
reviews.title: worth every penny

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: When my wife and I visited the UK last year it was a first for her, though I had been there several times on business. Part of our tour plan was to spend some time with friends of ours. In chatting with these friends prior to our trip my wife had casually mentioned that she would love to stay overnight in a castle. So, two pair of our friends took it upon themselves to set up a surprise for us while we were there. Neither of us ever dreamed that the surprise would be TWO nights in this absolutely gorgeous castle. We were put into the Duke's Bedchamber, supposedly the very room that Henry VIII himself had slept in. We enjoyed walking around the castle grounds and thoroughly enjoyed the sumptuous repast served to us the first night in the hotel's dining room. Staying here was truly a dream come true for us and was clearly the highlight of our trip to the UK, though our friends supplied us with many more exciting day trips. We couldn't begin to thank them enough for this wonderful gift.
reviews.title: Absolutely AWESOME

likes.liked: — The magnificent bed chambers and amenities

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a wonderful place! The castle is breathtaking along with the gardens outside. We were in the Mary I room--they treated us like royalty. The room was beautiful with a lovely curved glass window and a stained glass window in the bathroom. The staff was oustanding and willing to do whatever we asked. It is a memorable and lovely place. I could not recommend it more highly!
reviews.title: Jewel in the Crown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A majestic Tudor Castle with beautiful accomodation, scrumptious food and wine and exemplary service. Have nothing but praise for this hotel and would reccomend to anyone looking for a special night away in a quiet, quaint and quintessential setting.
reviews.title: Perfect!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading some indifferent reviews from this web page we were a little apprehensive, but decided to book a room anyway as the majority of reviewers rated it highly.
reviews.title: Very relaxing stay, shame about the food if you're vegetarian

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Thornbury Caste is a genuine medieval castle with really thick stone walls, low doors and fantastic stone spiral staircases (although not great to ascend after a few glasses of wine). Our room was in one of the towers and had a wonderful 4 poster bed and what we first thought was a genuine roaring fire (this was actually gas powered which makes sense for safety reasons). The room was nice and toastie even though it was bitterly cold outside. The bathroom was large with a bath and seperate shower cubicle and there were two very heavy bathrobes to wear (with hoods!!).
reviews.title: overated

likes.disliked: — no bar or ambience in hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2006
reviews.text: Whilst the room was fantastic, dinner was however a little disappointing. Pre dinner drinks were served in the library which was very pleasant, however after studying the menus we were surprised to discover that there wasn't a vegetarian alternative for the main course unless you went for the risotto. You expect a restaurant of this calibre to provide a seperate vegetarian menu. Considering we had asked for the vegetarian alternative and my wife then ordered a vegetarian starter and the one vegetarian main course, we were a little bemused when the appetiser we were offered as a gift from the chef was parma ham and melon. To be fair though once we pointed out that we didn't eat ham an alternative appetiser was produced and very tasty it was too. Whilst the food looked amazing, it didn't quite live up to other Von Essen hotels we have stayed in. It appeared as if presentation was perhaps more important than taste, although it was still good food.
reviews.title: Something Special

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We would visit again as the room was lovely, but perhaps we would eat elsewhere given the price compared to the standard.
reviews.title: The Perfect Castle

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had booked 2 nights for the Dukes Chamber and were very impressed with the room it was fantastic. Although we waited an hour for our luggage to be brought up from downstairs and had to request twice for the open fire to be lit.The lounge and library although very beautiful lacked any kind of ambience or atmosphere and felt uncomfortable speaking above a whisper. The dinner was extremely expensive and did not live up to expectation particularly the potato rosti which was so salty it was inedible!! The wine was very over priced and our decanter was put out of our reach which would have been okay had the waiter filled our glasses regularly in the end my husband walked across the dining room to reach it to refill our glasses! not what you would expect from a restuarant of this calibre. Breakfast was no better than your average b&b so made the decision to book out a day early and continue our honeymoon elsewhere.
reviews.title: Over and above expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Thornbury Castle for an anniversary, even though it was expensive for just the one night. However I was not dissapointed. On entering the castle your bags are immediately taken off you and you are treated like royalty.
reviews.title: A magical experience

likes.disliked: — Could have had a four poster bed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: On being shown to the room our bags arrived seconds later and were put away in the spacious walk-in wardrobe. We stayed in the Anne Boleyn room which had a beautiful view of the church and gardens, fantastic fire and luxurious bathroom. Little things such as home made biscuits and complimentary sherry (even though didn't try this) just make you feel as though you are in luxury. (5* sheraton in edinburgh please take note of how a premium hotel should be like).
reviews.title: Outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't have dinner at the hotel as we wanted to sample some of thornbury during our stay and were only there for the one night. On returning from thornbury to the castle we asked for some tea and coffee making facilities and before we got to our room this was already waiting for us outside. We also asked for our breakfast to be served to our rooms which was fantastic and at no extra cost (although you couldn't have cooked breakfast), but I could have eaten those eggs and croisants all day.
reviews.title: Definitly worth it

likes.liked: — Stunning rooms and ground, wonderful service and good restaurant.
likes.disliked: — Nothing much to do around there, unless you have a car.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Finally the big thing that impressed me was that gratuity wasn't automatically added to the bill. I am a firm believer that gratuities should be given for excellent service and not just for meeting expectations from a high priced hotel. I therefore gave a gratuity on checking out of Thornbury Castle as it is a fantastic experience and they understand the needs of the customer. The only issue I had with the stay was the weather, which although they can do almost anything else for you, this is out of the hotels control. However it does give you more time to enjoy the gorgeous, roaring fire.
reviews.title: Simply perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel for anyone!!!!
reviews.title: the best hotel we stayed in in uk

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled on business
reviews.text: I read some of the reviews on here after I had booked so set off with some trepidation! I am very fussy and have a strong views on how hotels should be run particularly country hotels.
reviews.title: Stunning, perfect unmissable

likes.liked: — the fact it was in a castle complere with arrowslit windows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: To say I was blown away and over the moon with my stay would be an understatement! Thornbury Castle exceeded my expectations in all areas. The staff are particularly magnificent. We have Valerie who is on the front desk who is your quintessential English lady and a total delight. When I was greeted by her I was enchanted as her charm and welcome were spot on.
reviews.title: Going Down Hill - Appalled

likes.disliked: — the decor, cleanliness, service and value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006
reviews.text: Then you have the wonderful Pepe who has been with the hotel over 30 years and was like a character out of Cluedo crossed with Manuel from Fawlty towers (but in a good way) come to life. He was charming and nothing was too much trouble. The general manager also knows just how to treat the guests and changed lunch times to fit me in.
reviews.title: Mostly Wonderful
Not the best anymore !!!!!!!
reviews.text: This hotel is as it should be, magnificent to look at with unique and colourful staff. The place is stunning and the only Tudor castle hotel in existence what more do you want? Yes the grandeur is slightly faded but also near perfect if you want the real deal, and it does retain its opulence. The Tudor garden is exquisite and I highly recommend champagne on the lawn.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2006
reviews.text: I haven’t even got to the food which was the most scrumptious food I have tasted in a hotel including outdoing anything I had eaten in Italian hotels or five star London hotels. It seems to taste just like your mother would have made (If she were a Michelin star chef!) but better!
reviews.title: Food and Service - Wonderful! Unique Experience
Grounds and Evening Meal Wonderful
reviews.text: Stayed for two nights in late April, in what I believe was the Stafford Suite. Furnishings - old flattened chair / lounge cushions, old wildly uncomfortable mattresses - I think by my standard of expectation were not up to par considering the 280 pounds sterling per night we paid, with full english. Breakfasts and evening meal were excellent however, as were the reception and staff in general. Bathroom was only a tub, with a carpeted floor which had some soft spots in the subfloor below. Definitely worth a look as the grounds and local district are beautiful, but try and haggle the best deal on the accommodation.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2005
reviews.text: Stayed at the castle in november 2005, it was a beautiful hotel and the grounds, though not substantial, were gorgeous and well kept.
reviews.title: Absolutely beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2004
reviews.text: We stayed in the Henry 8th room, which I highly reccommend although the other rooms are more than likely exquisite also. But this room had a winding stone staircase which just looked amazing and created a great atmosphere for the hotel.
reviews.title: Charming
Absolutely beautiful !
reviews.text: I also proposed to my fiancee at the castle and the staff were extremely helpful when I was co-ordinating the suprise. They went out of their way to help.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2006
reviews.text: The rooms decor was very nice, though the bed linen seemed a bit dull, it was lovely nonetheless and created the ancient gothic feel of the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful castle!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Thornbury castle is a unique experience. From the suit of armour that greets you in reception to the log fires, antique furniture and panelled walls, it is the attention to details that really sets this place apart. Set in beautiful gardens, the castle sits beside the church which adds to the historic atmosphere.
reviews.title: Fantastic historic castle combined with ultimate luxury.

likes.liked: — The historic building, food and attention to detail.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Each room is individually decorated. I stayed in Mary I, which is at the front of the hotel and boasted a beautiful oriel window, comfortable fourposter bed, walk in wardrobe and beautiful furniture throughout. The bathroom was modern with a good shower, plenty of hot water and Molton Brown toileteries.
reviews.title: Unique

likes.disliked: — The bathroom was a little tired relative to the quality of all other features

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are attentive and will do their best to see to your every need. Waiting staff at dinner discretely remembered who was eating which meal and drinking which wine and served appropriately, a nice touch.
reviews.title: Dreamy and Romantic

likes.liked: — Dreamy romantic atmosphere in a beautiful countryside location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The food at the hotel is exquisite. I had crisp belly pork to start, filet steak and cheese to finish. All local produce and cooked to perfection. The meals are not huge, but the food is rich, delicious and satisfying. The wines on offer are expensive but even the cheapest bottle (£28) was a really enjoyable Bordeaux which complimented the meal. Also on offer were local ales and wine produced on the estate from the vineyard.
reviews.title: Breathtaking Thornbury Castle

likes.liked: — The setting, and comfort - beds are very comfortable, with lots of great pillows
likes.disliked: — Everything was all that I expected and more.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a truely luxorious hotel which would be ideal for a romantic weekend or wedding night/location. I really could not fault the hotel at all.
reviews.title: Absolutly Faultless

aka: Thornbury Castle And Tudor Gardens Hotel Thornbury
